page.title: 08CLENT LANDSCAPE
page.content: Clent is very interesting to visit with friends. If you keep your eyes peeled you can see the wildlife and sheep and horse riding. There are map boards to help you around. You can then follow the yellow arrows around the hills. A lot of the land is owned by the National Trust who preserve the land for the country. At the top of the hill are the{Four Stones,}these look like ancient remains but in fact were put up by the Victorians about 100 years ago. Also on the side of the hill is an easier footpath called a { {Disabled Trail,}this is so that people in wheelchairs can get to the top as well.
